title: About Me
text: Hola, I’m Eivory Ortiz! I’m a girl in a silly little world (but I’m just a girl).

title: About Me
text:
Early Life
I was born in Troy, Michigan, raised here in Georgetown, KY. I have been active in my community from a very young age. I am an avid learner. I love to be creative and take non-convetional approaches to understanding the world around me as this has shaped me for the nexg sections.

title: About Me
text:
Georgetown College
I am a senior currently in Georgetown College, located in Georgetown, KY. I am going to gradaute with a bachelors in political science and computer science. During my time here I have been involved with SHMAC (Student Mental Health Adovocacy Council), Alpha Lambda Delta Honor Society (ALD), and Omicron Kappa Delta Honor Soceity (ODK). I am an independent in this college, meanining that I am not part of a fraternal organization.

title: About Me
text:
Ambitions
I hope that the future legal field will be able to come together with the computer science field to create a new branch. As we are currently in the age of AI and as such we should be attempting to bridge the gap between the two. Since the two are currently trying to understand one another from just solely their own field. Hence the reason why I and others are invested in bridging the two together by understanding the two to help come together to solve problems that are persisiting between the two.

title: About Me
text:
Future Life
I would like to be finanically independent and be able to further help those in understanding the dyanmics of the law and computer science. Mainly as it relates to specifically patent law and data privacy. I would like to be part of a group of lawyers that start a new legal field. Currently right now both areas I have mentioned are separate but I think bringing the two could help emerge one that has a concentration on A.I.

title: Articles
text: I am doing two homework problems from CSC324 in my college. Essentially these problems are from Eloquent Javascript Third Edition. I am going to explain flattening and everything from chapter 5 in the textbook.

title: Eivory Ortiz's Website Warmup
text:
This problem is a higher order function problem.


Below is the attached link for the chapter and then my solution via GitHub. In my CSC324 class we use GitHub, I hihgly recommend you use it too if you are beginning your computer science journey!

book here
here
 This function is from a textbook we used in this class known as Eloquent Javascript Third Edtion.
```js function every(array, predicate) { for (let element of array) { if (!predicate(element)) return false; } return true; }
function every2(array, predicate) { return !array.some(element => !predicate(element)); } console.log(every([1,3,5], n => n < 10)); console.log(every([2,4,16], n => n < 10)); console.log(every([], n => n < 10));

The code is taking an array and for every time the array goes through then it will.

title: Welcome!
text:
Welcome to my Warmup Website! It serves as the title suggests a precursor to a potential website I will be making.
